titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Robert Roberson and John Milum, Indictment
CWG7579

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Johnson Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Ky
against } Indictment
Robt Roberson & John Milum

The Grand Jury of Johnson County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Robt Roberson and John Milum of the offense of Grand Larceny commited as follows the Said Robt Roberson and John Milum on the 1st Day of may 1864 in the County and Circuit aforesaid did willfully and maliciously feloniously take Steal and cary off one hundred Dollars in current money and united States Green back and other Paper Clothing and a horse the personal property of Martin R. Rice of the value of more than four Dollars against the peace and Dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

$500 --
The Commonwealth
vs } Indictment
Robt Roberson & John Milum
A True Bill
B. Preston Foreman

Commonwealth witness
Martin. R. Rice, Martin M Rice Wm Fitzpatrick & Wife Clerenda Milum George Collins Mitchell Dotson & Wife & Steven Ston

A. Copy W. M. Conly
J. S. Dury comts atty.
